filmography.title: The Pink Panther
filmography.role_description: A bumbling, inept French police detective who is obsessed with catching the notorious jewel thief 'The Phantom' but is blissfully unaware that the thief is his wife's lover.
filmography.plot: The bumbling Inspector Clouseau travels to Rome to catch a notorious jewel thief known as 'The Phantom' before he can steal the priceless 'Pink Panther' diamond.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical; BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actor

filmography.title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
filmography.role: Group Captain Lionel Mandrake / President Merkin Muffley / Dr. Strangelove
filmography.role_description: Sellers plays three roles: a polite British RAF exchange officer trying to stop a nuclear attack, the ineffectual President of the United States, and a sinister, wheelchair-bound ex-Nazi nuclear scientist.
filmography.plot: An insane American general orders a bombing attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#26), 100 Laughs (#3)

filmography.title: Being There
filmography.role_description: A simple-minded, sheltered gardener who has only ever known the world through television becomes an unlikely political advisor when his simplistic utterings are mistaken for profound wisdom.
filmography.plot: After the death of his employer, a simple-minded gardener is thrust into the outside world where his naive statements are interpreted as deep political insights by the Washington elite.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical; BAFTA: Nominated – Best Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Laughs (#26)

filmography.title: A Shot in the Dark
filmography.role_description: The incompetent Inspector Clouseau is assigned to a high-profile murder case where he consistently clears the most obvious suspect because he has fallen in love with her.
filmography.plot: Inspector Clouseau investigates a murder at a country estate where all evidence points to a beautiful maid, but he refuses to believe she is guilty despite a growing body count.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actor (Nomination shared with The Pink Panther); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Laughs (#48)

filmography.title: The Ladykillers
filmography.role_description: A spiv and a teddy boy who is part of a bumbling criminal gang posing as a string quintet to rob a security van.
filmography.plot: A gang of criminals rents a room in an old lady's house to plan a robbery, but her innocent interference and their own incompetence lead to disaster.

filmography.title: Lolita
filmography.role_description: A mysterious, chameleonic playwright and television writer who becomes the rival and nemesis of the protagonist, Humbert Humbert.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged literature professor becomes obsessed with a teenage girl and marries her mother to be close to her, only to face a rival for her affections.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Party
filmography.role_description: A polite but accident-prone Indian actor who is accidentally invited to a lavish Hollywood dinner party, where he inadvertently causes chaos.
filmography.plot: A clerical error invites a clumsy Indian actor to an exclusive Hollywood party, where his good intentions result in a series of escalating disasters.

filmography.title: I'm All Right Jack
filmography.role_description: A stubborn, self-important trade union shop steward who rigorously enforces union rules and clashes with management and a new, upper-class employee.
filmography.plot: A naive upper-class man takes a job at a missile factory and unwittingly sparks a major labor dispute involving a corrupt uncle and a zealous union leader.

filmography.title: The Mouse That Roared
filmography.role: Grand Duchess Gloriana XII / Prime Minister Count Rupert Mountjoy / Tully Bascombe
filmography.role_description: Sellers plays three roles: the elderly female monarch of a tiny European duchy, her crafty Prime Minister, and the mild-mannered game warden who leads an invasion of the United States.
filmography.plot: The tiny Duchy of Grand Fenwick declares war on the United States in hopes of losing and receiving foreign aid, but their invasion force accidentally wins.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actor (for Yesterday's Enemy, but this film was cited in critical acclaim)

filmography.title: The Return of the Pink Panther
filmography.role_description: Clouseau, demoted to a beat cop, is reinstated to investigate the theft of the Pink Panther diamond, wreaking havoc along the way.
filmography.plot: Inspector Clouseau is called back to investigate the theft of the Pink Panther diamond from a museum in Lugash, suspecting the famous Phantom.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: The Pink Panther Strikes Again
filmography.role_description: The clumsy inspector must survive a dozen assassins sent by his former boss, Chief Inspector Dreyfus, who has been driven insane by Clouseau's incompetence.
filmography.plot: Former Chief Inspector Dreyfus escapes from an asylum and threatens to destroy the world with a doomsday machine unless Clouseau is eliminated.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther
filmography.role_description: Clouseau is presumed dead after an assassination attempt, allowing him to go undercover in disguise to find the drug lord who ordered the hit.
filmography.plot: Inspector Clouseau fakes his own death to investigate a plot against him by a French drug kingpin who wants to impress his American partners.

filmography.title: Only Two Can Play
filmography.role_description: A bored, lecherous Welsh librarian who contemplates an affair with the glamorous wife of a local official to advance his career.
filmography.plot: A frustrated librarian in a small Welsh town considers cheating on his wife with a socialite who promises to help him get a promotion.

filmography.title: The Wrong Arm of the Law
filmography.role_description: A cockney criminal mastermind who poses as a French fashion designer to run a gang of thieves.
filmography.plot: A gang leader forms an uneasy alliance with Scotland Yard to catch a group of Australian impostors who are impersonating police officers to steal from criminals.

filmography.title: Heavens Above!
filmography.role_description: A naive but well-meaning prison chaplain who is accidentally appointed as the vicar of a wealthy, snobbish parish.
filmography.plot: A clerical error sends a socialist vicar to a conservative town, where his attempts to practice true Christian charity cause economic and social chaos.

filmography.title: Two Way Stretch
filmography.role_description: A crafty inmate who devises a plan to break out of prison to commit a robbery and then break back in to establish an alibi.
filmography.plot: Three prisoners plan to break out of their cell, steal a shipment of diamonds, and break back into prison before they are missed.

filmography.title: Murder by Death
filmography.role_description: A parody of Charlie Chan, Wang is a brilliant Chinese detective who constantly speaks in broken English and proverbs.
filmography.plot: Five famous literary detectives are invited to a mysterious castle to solve a murder that hasn't happened yet.

filmography.title: The Battle of the Sexes
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered, elderly Scottish accountant who plots to murder a brash American efficiency expert threatening his traditional way of life.
filmography.plot: A timid accountant in a Scottish tweed company decides to eliminate an American female efficiency expert who plans to modernize the business.

filmography.title: After the Fox
filmography.role_description: A master thief and master of disguise who poses as a film director to smuggle stolen gold into Italy.
filmography.plot: A criminal mastermind escapes from prison and poses as a neo-realist film director to smuggle gold bars into Italy under the guise of filming a movie.

filmography.title: The Optimists
filmography.role_description: An aging, grumpy street busker who lives in a London slum with his dog and befriends two local children.
filmography.plot: An old street musician strikes up an unlikely friendship with two children who help him recapture some of his former happiness.

filmography.title: The Dock Brief
filmography.role_description: An incompetent, aging barrister who gets his first case in years defending a man who has confessed to murdering his wife.
filmography.plot: An unsuccessful lawyer defends a man accused of murdering his wife, concocting elaborate legal defenses for a client who just wants to plead guilty.

filmography.title: Hoffman
filmography.role_description: A creepy, manipulative businessman who blackmails his attractive secretary into spending a week at his apartment.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged man blackmails a young woman into staying with him for a week, hoping to make her fall in love with him.

filmography.title: Never Let Go
filmography.role_description: A rare dramatic role as a vicious, sadistic car theft ringleader who terrorizes a salesman trying to recover his stolen car.
filmography.plot: A struggling salesman's car is stolen, and when the police fail to help, he tracks it down to a violent racketeer.

filmography.title: The Magic Christian
filmography.role_description: An eccentric billionaire who adopts a homeless man and sets out to prove that everyone has a price.
filmography.plot: The world's richest man and his adopted son set out to demonstrate the greed of humanity through a series of elaborate and expensive practical jokes.

filmography.title: I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
filmography.role_description: A straight-laced Jewish lawyer who leaves his conventional life behind to join the hippie counterculture after eating marijuana brownies.
filmography.plot: A successful but stressed lawyer drops out of society to become a hippie after falling for a free-spirited woman.

filmography.title: Casino Royale
filmography.role_description: A baccarat master recruited to impersonate James Bond and defeat the villain Le Chiffre at the gaming table.
filmography.plot: In this spy spoof, Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH, confusing the enemy by renaming all agents 'James Bond'.
